p: General measures of isolation, quarantine, and distancing must be followed. Transmission through fomites is highly likely, so care should be taken in handling and disposing of the same. Health care workers, family members and caretakers of the patients should take due precautions. Stay in well-ventilated places reduces the chances of contracting the infection. Razi's advice of avoiding airflow from the patient to a healthy person is remarkable. For this purpose, the patient should face away from healthy people while coughing, sneezing or talking, as the virus may also be excreted through saliva ( Razi, 1991).
